wiki_catalogs.name: System Overview
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on the escrowgrid platform. Explain its purpose as a Trust-as-a-Service (TaaS) system for financial escrow, asset tokenization, and position lifecycle management. Describe the core concepts including multi-tenancy, policy enforcement, dual ledger design (on-chain and off-chain), and institutional access control. Provide a high-level architectural overview showing frontend, backend, database, and blockchain integration. Include target audience details (developers, financial institutions, compliance officers). Use diagrams to illustrate system context and data flow. Link to key features and components with brief explanations to guide new users through the platform's value proposition and operational model.

wiki_catalogs.name: Backend Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the escrowgrid backend. Describe the layered architecture with clear separation between API, domain, infrastructure, middleware, and storage layers. Illustrate component interactions using sequence and component diagrams. Explain key architectural patterns: dependency injection, policy pattern, event sourcing for position lifecycle, and pluggable storage. Document service responsibilities for each router in src/api and their integration with domain logic. Detail the role of middleware in authentication, logging, and rate limiting. Explain how configuration from config.ts is injected across components. Include technology stack implications on architecture and constraints.

wiki_catalogs.name: Institution Model
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the Institution entity in the escrowgrid platform. Detail all fields including id, name, regions, verticals, createdAt, and updatedAt with their data types, constraints, and purposes. Explain that institutions serve as the top-level organizational unit in this multi-tenant Trust-as-a-Service platform, enabling region- and vertical-specific configurations. Document the primary key constraint on id, and describe how regions and verticals are stored as arrays in PostgreSQL and typed as string unions in TypeScript. Include sample data for a financial institution operating in the US and EU_UK in the TRADE_FINANCE vertical. Explain foreign key relationships to asset_templates, assets, positions, api_keys, audit_events, and institution_policies. Discuss data access patterns such as institution-based filtering for multi-tenancy and reference schema.sql for DDL and types.ts for the TypeScript interface. Address data validation rules, lifecycle management, and security implications of institution-level access control.

wiki_catalogs.name: In-Memory Storage
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the in-memory storage implementation in escrowgrid. Explain how memoryStore.ts implements the Store interface for ephemeral data storage using JavaScript objects and maps. Document its use cases for development, testing, and stateless environments. Include performance characteristics, data consistency guarantees, and limitations regarding persistence and scalability. Provide code examples showing instantiation and configuration via config.ts. Discuss integration with the API layer and implications for position lifecycle management. Address common issues such as data loss on restart and memory consumption under load, with mitigation strategies.

wiki_catalogs.name: Institutions API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive API documentation for the Institutions API endpoints in the escrowgrid platform. Document all HTTP methods (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE) and their respective URL patterns for creating, retrieving, updating, and listing institutions. Specify request body schemas, query parameters, response formats, and status codes (200, 201, 400, 401, 403, 404, 500). Include authentication requirements using API keys via the authMiddleware, emphasizing root user privileges for creation. Detail the Institution data model fields (id, name, regions, verticals) and provide real-world usage examples from the codebase. Explain error handling scenarios such as duplicate names or invalid regions. Reference the integration with policy enforcement and audit logging on creation. Address rate limiting behavior inherited from middleware and provide client-side implementation guidance for CRUD operations.

wiki_catalogs.name: API Key Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the API key management system in escrowgrid. Explain the creation, listing, and revocation of API keys through dedicated REST endpoints. Document the role-based permissions (admin, read_only) and institution-level scoping of keys. Include implementation details from apiKeys.ts, covering request validation, access control checks, and audit logging integration. Provide concrete examples of creating an API key with custom role and label, and retrieving keys for an institution. Describe the data model for API keys, including token generation, storage, and secure transmission. Address common issues such as permission denied errors and invalid institution references, with troubleshooting guidance. Highlight security practices like token redaction in logs and response sanitization.

wiki_catalogs.name: Health Checks
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the health check system in escrowgrid. Explain the implementation of the checkReadiness function in health.ts, including its role in Kubernetes liveness and readiness probes. Document the different readiness states based on storage backend (in-memory vs PostgreSQL), database connectivity validation, and error handling during connection attempts. Include examples of HTTP responses for healthy and unhealthy states. Describe integration with the Express server and how the health endpoint is exposed. Provide troubleshooting guidance for common database connection issues and configuration errors. Address best practices for monitoring backend dependencies in production environments.

wiki_catalogs.name: Configuration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the on-chain integration configuration in escrowgrid. Explain how environment variables such as ONCHAIN_RPC_URL, ONCHAIN_PRIVATE_KEY, and ONCHAIN_CONTRACT_ADDRESS are used to initialize the Ethereum connection. Document the role of onchainLedgerEnabled flag in toggling the feature globally. Describe chain ID validation and how mismatches between configuration and asset template settings are handled. Include practical examples of .env configuration, error scenarios during initialization, and security best practices for private key management. Address common issues like invalid RPC URLs or incorrect chain IDs and provide troubleshooting guidance.

wiki_catalogs.name: Docker Deployment
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for deploying the escrowgrid platform using Docker and docker-compose. Detail the multi-stage Docker build process, including dependency installation, artifact compilation, and production image optimization. Explain the docker-compose.yml configuration, covering service definitions for the API, database, and admin console, including container networking, environment variable injection, health checks, and port mapping. Provide step-by-step instructions for building images, starting services, and verifying deployment. Include best practices for container security, resource limits, and orchestration in production environments. Address common issues such as container startup failures, network connectivity problems, and volume mounting errors.

wiki_catalogs.name: Unit Testing
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for unit testing in escrowgrid using Vitest. Explain the configuration in vitest.config.ts, including test environment setup and file inclusion patterns. Document the structure of api.test.ts, covering test organization, assertion patterns, and use of mocks for dependencies like storage and policy enforcement. Provide examples from the actual test files showing how individual API endpoints are tested in isolation. Include guidance on writing new unit tests, mocking infrastructure components, and debugging test failures. Address best practices for test maintainability, speed, and coverage metrics.

wiki_catalogs.name: API Layer
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the API layer of escrowgrid. Explain its role in handling HTTP requests and responses, routing, and integration with middleware and domain logic. Document each API router (institutions, assets, positions, policies, ledger, metrics, apiKeys) with their respective endpoints, request/response schemas, and authentication requirements. Include practical examples of API usage from the codebase, such as position creation or institution management. Illustrate data flow from incoming request through middleware to business logic and storage. Address error handling patterns, validation strategies, and versioning considerations. Highlight how OpenAPI/Swagger documentation is generated via openapi.ts and integrated into the system.

wiki_catalogs.name: Asset Templates API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed API documentation for the Asset Templates functionality in escrowgrid. Cover all endpoints under /asset-templates including POST (create), GET (list and get by id). Document the request body schema (institutionId, code, name, vertical, region, config), required fields, and validation rules. Explain the institution scoping logic: root users can specify any institution, while institutional API keys are restricted to their own institution. Detail the relationship between vertical and region fields as defined in the domain model. Include examples of valid template configurations for financial instruments like CONSTR_ESCROW and TF_LC. Specify response formats, status codes (201 on creation, 400 for validation errors, 403 for access violations), and error payloads. Highlight integration with audit logging (ASSET_TEMPLATE_CREATED event) and policy validation during creation. Explain how templates are used as blueprints for asset creation and their role in enforcing compliance rules based on vertical-specific configurations. Provide client implementation examples in JavaScript/TypeScript showing proper authentication with API keys and handling of edge cases like duplicate codes or invalid regions.

wiki_catalogs.name: Position Lifecycle Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the position lifecycle management system in escrowgrid. Explain how the PositionState enum and PositionLifecycleEvent interface in types.ts define valid states (e.g., draft, active, settled, closed) and track state transitions. Document the implementation in lifecycle.ts that governs allowable transitions, enforces business rules during state changes, and emits lifecycle events. Provide concrete examples from the codebase showing how a position moves from creation to settlement or closure. Explain the relationship between lifecycle logic and API endpoints in positions.ts, as well as integration with audit logging and ledger recording. Address common issues such as invalid state transitions, handling of idempotent operations, and error recovery. Include performance considerations around event sourcing and state validation overhead.

wiki_catalogs.name: Ledger Systems
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the ledger systems in escrowgrid. Describe the dual ledger architecture that separates off-chain operations (in-memory and PostgreSQL) from on-chain Ethereum integration. Explain how the LedgerClient interface provides a unified abstraction across different ledger implementations. Detail the implementation of InMemoryLedger for ephemeral storage and PostgresLedger for durable persistence, including their respective recordPositionCreated and recordPositionStateChanged methods. Document the on-chain integration via OnchainLedger, which conditionally writes position events to a smart contract based on asset template configuration. Explain the CompositeLedger pattern that enables simultaneous writes to both base and on-chain ledgers. Include configuration dependencies from config.ts, error handling strategies, and structured logging practices. Provide examples of event recording flows and address scalability, consistency, and failure recovery considerations.

wiki_catalogs.name: Institutions API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the Institutions API endpoints in escrowgrid. Document the POST /, GET /, and GET /:id routes with their HTTP methods, request/response schemas, and authentication requirements. Explain the role of root vs. institution-level access control and how multi-tenancy is enforced. Include examples of creating a new institution and retrieving institution lists or specific institution details. Detail error handling scenarios such as forbidden access, invalid request bodies, and not-found conditions. Highlight integration with the audit logger for INSTITUTION_CREATED events and describe how the store interface is used for persistence. Address validation rules for required fields like name and regions, and explain the relationship between institutions and other resources like assets and positions.

wiki_catalogs.name: Authentication Middleware
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the authentication middleware in escrowgrid. Explain how auth.ts validates API keys from the 'x-api-key' or 'Authorization: Bearer' headers and distinguishes between root and institution-level keys. Detail the role-based access control mechanism that supports 'root', 'admin', and 'read_only' roles, and how the AuthContext is attached to Express requests. Describe the integration with apiKeyStore for token lookup and the bypass logic for public endpoints like /health and /docs. Provide code examples showing the authMiddleware function registration in server.ts and usage of requireWriteAccess in API routes. Address common issues such as invalid token handling, root key misconfiguration, and performance implications of async key lookups. Include security considerations around token exposure and best practices for key rotation.

wiki_catalogs.name: Storage Interface Abstraction
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the storage interface abstraction defined in store.ts. Explain how the Store interface provides a unified contract for all data persistence operations across the escrowgrid platform, including institution, asset, template, and position management. Document each method signature, parameters, return types, and expected behavior. Illustrate how this abstraction enables pluggable storage backends by decoupling business logic from persistence concerns. Provide code examples showing how API and domain layers interact with this interface without knowledge of the underlying implementation. Address error handling patterns, data consistency guarantees, and extension points for adding new methods or entities. Highlight the use of TypeScript interfaces for type safety and contract enforcement.

wiki_catalogs.name: API Key Store
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed documentation for the API Key Store service in escrowgrid. Explain the ApiKeyStore interface and its two implementations: InMemoryApiKeyStore and PostgresApiKeyStore. Document the purpose of each method (createKey, findByToken, listByInstitution), including parameters, return types, and error conditions. Describe how API key hashing ensures security and how revoked keys are handled. Detail the configuration-driven instantiation based on storeBackend setting. Provide examples of creating and validating API keys, and explain integration with the authentication middleware. Include performance and consistency trade-offs between in-memory and PostgreSQL backends. Address common issues such as token leakage, key revocation workflows, and database connection failures.

wiki_catalogs.name: Off-Chain Ledger
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the off-chain ledger system in escrowgrid. Explain the dual implementation using InMemoryLedger for ephemeral, test-friendly storage and PostgresLedger for durable, ACID-compliant persistence. Describe how the base ledger is selected at runtime via the storeBackend configuration in config.ts. Detail the LedgerClient interface abstraction that standardizes operations like recordPositionCreated and recordPositionStateChanged across implementations. Document transaction handling, error recovery, and consistency guarantees in PostgresLedger, including its use of parameterized queries and structured logging. Highlight use cases for each backend: in-memory for development and testing, PostgreSQL for production workloads. Include integration with the CompositeLedger pattern and explain data flow from API layer to storage. Provide code examples of ledger interactions and address performance considerations such as indexing and connection pooling for PostgresLedger.

wiki_catalogs.name: Technology Stack
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on the escrowgrid technology stack. Detail the backend stack (Node.js, Express, TypeScript), frontend stack (React, TypeScript), database (PostgreSQL), and blockchain integration (Ethers.js). Explain the rationale behind each technology choice and how they interoperate. Include version compatibility, dependency management via npm, and tooling (Vite, Vitest). Highlight full-stack TypeScript usage across services. Provide insights into framework-specific patterns used in the codebase. This section should serve as a reference for developers evaluating or onboarding to the tech stack.

wiki_catalogs.name: Data Flow
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the data flow within the escrowgrid platform. Thoroughly explain the end-to-end request processing pipeline from HTTP ingress to response egress, including middleware processing, API routing, domain logic execution, storage interaction, and audit logging. Use the position creation and lifecycle transition as a primary example to illustrate event sourcing and policy enforcement. Include concrete examples from the actual codebase showing how data flows through institutionsRouter, positionsRouter, and ledgerRouter. Document error handling, transaction boundaries, and consistency guarantees. Address common issues like race conditions and their solutions.

wiki_catalogs.name: Asset Template Model
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the AssetTemplate entity in the escrowgrid platform. Detail all fields: id, institutionId, code, name, vertical, region, config, createdAt, and updatedAt, specifying their data types, constraints, and business meaning. Explain that asset templates define reusable blueprints for financial assets within an institution, supporting standardized asset creation. Document the primary key on id, foreign key to institutions(id) with cascade delete, and the idx_asset_templates_institution index for query performance. Describe how the config field uses JSONB for flexible, schema-less configuration per asset type. Reference both schema.sql for database structure and types.ts for the TypeScript interface. Include sample data showing a trade finance asset template in the US region. Explain relationships to the Asset model via template_id and discuss validation rules ensuring templates are region- and vertical-specific. Address use cases in asset tokenization and compliance enforcement.

wiki_catalogs.name: PostgreSQL Persistence
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the PostgreSQL persistence layer in escrowgrid. Detail how postgresStore.ts implements the Store interface using PostgreSQL for durable, relational data storage. Document table mappings for institutions, asset templates, assets, and positions as defined in schema.sql. Explain connection pooling, transaction handling, and error recovery mechanisms. Include configuration options for connection strings, retry logic, and isolation levels via config.ts. Provide usage examples for CRUD operations and complex queries. Address performance considerations including indexing strategies, query optimization, and concurrency patterns. Discuss migration strategies from in-memory to PostgreSQL and backup/restore procedures.

wiki_catalogs.name: Assets & Asset Templates API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed API documentation for the Assets and Asset Templates functionality in escrowgrid. Cover both /asset-templates and /assets endpoints, including POST, GET, PUT, and DELETE operations. For asset templates, document schema requirements (code, name, vertical, region, config), institution scoping, and validation rules. For assets, detail creation based on templates, metadata structure, and holder associations. Specify request/response payloads, query filtering options, and error conditions (e.g., invalid template reference). Highlight the relationship between asset templates and institutional verticals from the domain model. Include examples of template configuration for different financial instruments. Explain authentication via API key with institution-level access control and role-based permissions (admin vs read_only). Reference integration points with policy checks during creation and audit logging. Provide usage patterns for asset lifecycle management and client implementation best practices.

wiki_catalogs.name: Authentication Flow
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the authentication flow in escrowgrid. Detail how the authMiddleware intercepts requests, extracts API keys from x-api-key header or Authorization: Bearer scheme, and validates them against root key or stored institutional keys. Explain the bypass rules for public endpoints like /health and /docs. Document the integration with apiKeyStore for token lookup and the population of req.auth context. Include code examples showing successful and failed authentication paths, with corresponding HTTP responses. Describe the fallback behavior when no token is present and error handling for backend failures. Address security considerations such as timing attack resistance and error message leakage. Provide guidance on configuring the root API key via environment variables and best practices for key distribution and rotation.

wiki_catalogs.name: Metrics Collection
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the metrics collection subsystem in escrowgrid. Document the RequestMetricsSnapshot interface and its fields (totalRequests, totalErrors, requestsByStatus, requestsByMethod, averageDurationMs). Explain how the recordRequestMetric function captures method, status, and duration data from each request. Describe the internal state management using counters and duration accumulation. Detail how requestLogger middleware integrates with metrics.ts to automatically record timing and status data. Provide examples of how to access and interpret the metrics endpoint output. Include guidance on integrating with Prometheus, setting up Grafana dashboards, and defining alerting rules for error rates and latency thresholds. Address thread safety considerations and performance impact of metrics collection in high-throughput scenarios.

wiki_catalogs.name: Event Recording & Lifecycle Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for on-chain event handling in escrowgrid. Thoroughly explain how POSITION_CREATED and POSITION_STATE_CHANGED events are recorded on-chain via the recordPositionEvent contract function. Detail the payload structure for each event type, including institutionId, assetId, state transitions, and metadata. Explain the dual ledger design where off-chain and on-chain records are synchronized. Document the interaction between OnchainLedger class and LedgerClient interface, including error handling and logging strategies. Provide code examples showing event flow from position lifecycle changes to transaction submission. Address failure recovery, transaction confirmation monitoring, and idempotency considerations.

wiki_catalogs.name: Environment Configuration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content on configuring the escrowgrid platform through environment variables and the config.ts module. Explain how configuration values are loaded and validated at runtime, including STORE_BACKEND, DATABASE_URL, ROOT_API_KEY, and rate limiting parameters. Document the relationship between environment variables in docker-compose.yml and their consumption in config.ts. Cover configuration for optional features like on-chain ledger integration. Provide examples of environment setups for development, staging, and production environments. Include guidance on secure handling of secrets, configuration validation, and fallback mechanisms. Address common misconfiguration issues and debugging strategies.

wiki_catalogs.name: Integration Testing
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for integration testing in escrowgrid. Focus on how api.postgres.test.ts validates end-to-end interactions between API endpoints, domain logic, and PostgreSQL persistence layer. Explain test setup with real database connections, transaction rollback strategies, and data seeding. Compare integration vs unit test scopes, highlighting how these tests verify middleware chaining, authentication enforcement, and ledger-audit consistency. Use concrete examples from the codebase to show testing of position creation with policy validation and institution-scoped access control. Include debugging tips, test data management, and performance considerations when running integration suites.

wiki_catalogs.name: Domain Logic
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the domain logic layer of escrowgrid. Thoroughly explain the implementation of core business concepts including position lifecycle management, policy enforcement, audit logging, and vertical/region-based constraints. Detail how domain models like Position, Asset, and Institution are defined in types.ts and manipulated by lifecycle.ts and policy.ts. Provide concrete examples from the codebase showing state transitions and rule validation. Explain the relationship between domain logic and infrastructure services like auditLogger and policyStore. Address common issues such as invalid state transitions or policy violations and how they are handled. Include performance considerations for rule evaluation and event sourcing.

wiki_catalogs.name: Assets API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed API documentation for the Assets functionality in escrowgrid. Cover all endpoints under /assets including POST (create), GET (list and get by id). Document the request body schema (institutionId, templateId, label, metadata), with emphasis on templateId as a required reference to an existing asset template. Explain the validation flow: template existence, institution ownership, and metadata structure. Detail the institution context resolution logic similar to asset templates, with root vs institutional API key behaviors. Describe the response structure including auto-generated id, timestamps, and full template linkage. Include examples of asset creation for different template types (e.g., construction escrow, trade finance). Specify all HTTP status codes (201 Created, 400 Bad Request for missing fields, 403 Forbidden for cross-institution creation, 404 Not Found for invalid templateId). Highlight integration points with audit logging (ASSET_CREATED event) and the requirement that assets must reference valid, institution-owned templates. Explain filtering options in the list endpoint using institutionId and templateId query parameters. Provide practical usage patterns, such as bulk asset creation and lookup strategies for frontend applications like the admin console.

wiki_catalogs.name: Policy Enforcement Engine
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the policy enforcement engine in escrowgrid. Explain how policy.ts implements rule-based validation for operations on positions, assets, and institutions using configurable policies. Detail the Policy and PolicyRule type definitions in types.ts and how they support conditions based on institution, vertical, region, amount, or custom metadata. Provide concrete examples from the codebase showing policy evaluation during position creation or state transitions. Explain the integration between domain-level policy checks and the infrastructure-level policyStore for loading and managing policies. Address common issues such as policy conflicts, rule evaluation performance, and debugging failed validations. Include guidance on extending the policy engine with new condition types and best practices for policy versioning and testing.

wiki_catalogs.name: Audit Logging
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model and architectural documentation for the audit logging system in escrowgrid. Detail the AuditLogger interface and its implementations: InMemoryAuditLogger for development/testing and PostgresAuditLogger for production durability. Explain how audit events are captured during API operations, including authentication context, HTTP method, path, action, and resource information. Document the structured JSON logging format used for observability and compliance. Describe the database schema for audit_events table and its relationship to other entities. Explain configuration-driven instantiation via auditLoggerInstance and integration with the middleware layer. Include examples of audit trail generation, query patterns for compliance reporting, and performance considerations for high-volume environments. Address security requirements for log integrity and retention policies.

wiki_catalogs.name: Assets API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the Assets API endpoints in escrowgrid. Document the POST /, GET /, and GET /:id routes with their HTTP methods, request/response schemas, and authentication requirements. Explain how asset creation requires templateId and label, and how institution context is derived from API key or explicitly provided for root users. Describe access control rules that prevent cross-institution asset creation for non-root users. Include practical examples of creating an asset and querying assets by institutionId or templateId. Detail error conditions such as missing required fields, unauthorized access, and asset not found. Explain integration with audit logging (ASSET_CREATED) and the use of the store interface for asset persistence. Clarify the relationship between assets and asset templates.

wiki_catalogs.name: Rate Limiting Middleware
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the rate limiting middleware in escrowgrid. Explain the in-memory rate limiting strategy based on API key and IP address, using fixed-window or sliding-window counters. Detail configuration options such as max requests per window, window duration, and whether rate limiting is enabled globally. Describe how the middleware integrates with Express to intercept requests and respond with 429 Too Many Requests when thresholds are exceeded. Provide code examples showing middleware registration and interaction with other middleware like auth.ts (e.g., rate limiting after authentication). Address common issues like memory bloat under high concurrency, uneven distribution across instances in clustered environments, and bypass mechanisms for trusted IPs. Include performance considerations and recommendations for production use, such as integrating Redis for distributed rate limiting.

wiki_catalogs.name: In-Memory Storage Implementation
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the in-memory storage implementation (memoryStore.ts). Detail how MemoryStore class implements the Store interface using JavaScript Map objects for efficient in-process data storage. Explain the implementation of each CRUD operation, including ID generation, timestamp management, and referential integrity checks between institutions, templates, assets, and positions. Document the validation logic for asset templates using validateTemplateConfig. Describe data isolation mechanisms and limitations regarding persistence, scalability, and memory usage. Provide performance benchmarks, use cases for development/testing environments, and known limitations such as lack of transaction support and data volatility. Include troubleshooting guidance for common issues like memory leaks or data inconsistency during concurrent operations.

wiki_catalogs.name: Policy Store
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed documentation for the Policy Store service in escrowgrid. Explain the PolicyStore interface and its implementations: InMemoryPolicyStore and PostgresPolicyStore. Document each method (upsertPolicy, getPolicy, listPolicies) with parameters, return values, and behavior semantics. Describe how policies are uniquely identified by institutionId and region, and how upsert operations work with ON CONFLICT clauses in PostgreSQL. Explain the data model for InstitutionPolicy and its usage in the policy enforcement engine. Detail configuration options and backend selection via storeBackend. Provide examples of setting regional compliance rules and retrieving policies for validation. Discuss consistency requirements, caching considerations, and transactional integrity. Address common issues like stale policy reads, schema mismatches in config JSON, and connection pooling limits.

wiki_catalogs.name: On-Chain Ledger Integration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed documentation for the on-chain ledger functionality in escrowgrid. Explain how the OnchainLedger class integrates with EVM-compatible blockchains using Ethers.js to record position events as on-chain attestations. Describe the conditional activation based on the onchainLedgerEnabled flag in config.ts and asset template configuration. Document the smart contract interaction pattern, including contract instantiation, transaction signing, and event emission. Detail error handling during blockchain communication, including network failures, gas issues, and contract reverts, with fallback logging strategies. Explain the role of the CompositeLedger in synchronizing off-chain and on-chain writes. Provide examples of when on-chain recording is triggered (e.g., position creation or state changes) and how transaction hashes are captured in audit trails. Address security considerations such as private key management, replay protection, and chain selection. Include performance implications and latency trade-offs of on-chain operations.

wiki_catalogs.name: Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the escrowgrid platform. Describe the layered architecture with clear separation between API, domain, infrastructure, middleware, and storage layers. Illustrate component interactions using sequence and component diagrams. Explain key architectural patterns: dependency injection, policy pattern, event sourcing for position lifecycle, and pluggable storage. Document system boundaries, service responsibilities, and integration points. Discuss scalability considerations, fault tolerance, and deployment topology. Address cross-cutting concerns like logging, monitoring, and configuration management. Include technology stack implications on architecture and constraints.

wiki_catalogs.name: Integration Patterns
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for integration patterns in escrowgrid. Describe how the platform integrates with external systems including PostgreSQL database, Ethereum blockchain via Ethers.js, monitoring endpoints, and external authentication providers. Explain the abstraction layer provided by the infra directory and how it enables pluggable integrations. Document connection management, error handling, and retry strategies for each integration. Include protocol-specific details for database connectivity, blockchain transaction submission, and metrics exposure. Provide integration examples from the codebase and address common integration challenges and debugging approaches.

wiki_catalogs.name: Asset Model
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the Asset entity in the escrowgrid platform. Detail each field: id, institutionId, templateId, label, metadata, createdAt, and updatedAt, including their data types, constraints, and roles in the system. Explain that assets represent tokenized financial instruments instantiated from asset templates, serving as the foundation for position creation. Document the primary key on id, foreign keys to institutions(id) and asset_templates(id) with cascade delete, and the indexes on institution_id and template_id for efficient querying. Describe the metadata field as JSONB for extensible, asset-specific data. Reference schema.sql for DDL and types.ts for the TypeScript interface. Provide sample data for an asset created from a trade finance template. Explain the relationship to the Position model and discuss data validation rules ensuring asset integrity and traceability.

wiki_catalogs.name: Storage Configuration & Backend Selection
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for storage configuration and backend selection in escrowgrid. Explain how the pluggable storage architecture is initialized through index.ts based on runtime configuration in config.ts. Document environment variables that control storage backend selection (in-memory vs PostgreSQL). Describe the factory pattern used to instantiate the appropriate Store implementation. Cover integration points with the ledger system and how storage choices affect audit logging and data durability. Provide guidance on selecting appropriate backends for development, staging, and production environments. Include troubleshooting tips for common configuration errors and connectivity issues.

wiki_catalogs.name: Positions API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive API documentation for the Positions API, which manages financial position lifecycles in the escrowgrid system. Document all endpoints for creating, retrieving, and transitioning positions through defined states (e.g., pending, active, settled, closed). Specify required fields such as assetId, holderReference, currency, and amount, along with state transition rules enforced by the domain logic. Detail the response structure including position events and state history. Explain how each state change triggers ledger updates (both off-chain and on-chain) and audit logging. Include authentication and authorization requirements: institution-scoped access via API key, with role-based restrictions on state transitions. Document error responses for invalid transitions, insufficient funds, or policy violations. Provide real-world examples of position creation and lifecycle progression from test cases. Address performance considerations for high-frequency position updates and integration with metrics collection.

wiki_catalogs.name: Access Control & Authorization
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the access control and authorization mechanisms in escrowgrid. Explain the role-based access control (RBAC) model with root, admin, and read_only roles, and how they are enforced across API endpoints. Document the requireWriteAccess function that blocks read_only keys from mutating operations. Illustrate how authorization decisions are made in API routes by evaluating the authenticated user's role and institution affiliation. Provide examples from apiKeys.ts showing how only root or institution-admin users can create or list API keys. Describe the audit logging of authorization events and the structure of the auth context object. Address common issues like permission denied errors and provide troubleshooting steps. Include best practices for least-privilege key assignment and secure session management.

wiki_catalogs.name: Request Logging
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for the request logging mechanism in escrowgrid. Explain the implementation of the requestLogger middleware, including how it captures start time, computes request duration in milliseconds, and logs structured JSON output. Document the log payload fields: type, method, path, status, durationMs, apiKeyId, and institutionId. Describe the integration with Node.js 'finish' event on the response object to ensure logging occurs after response completion. Explain how this logging complements the metrics system by providing audit trails for debugging and compliance. Provide examples of log output and guidance on log aggregation with tools like ELK or Splunk. Include best practices for log retention, security (PII handling), and performance optimization when logging at scale.

wiki_catalogs.name: Security & Transaction Safety
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for security aspects of on-chain integration in escrowgrid. Explain how private key management is handled through environment variables and the risks of exposure. Document the use of Ethers.js Wallet and JsonRpcProvider for secure transaction signing. Describe the validation checks performed before on-chain recording, including asset/template existence and chain ID alignment. Explain the logging of transaction hashes and errors for auditability. Provide guidance on securing deployment environments, using hardware wallets or key management services, and protecting against replay attacks. Include examples of secure configuration practices and monitoring for suspicious activity.

wiki_catalogs.name: Database Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for database setup, backup, and restore operations in the escrowgrid platform. Detail the initialization process via schema.sql and docker-entrypoint-initdb.d integration. Explain the functionality of backup.sh and restore.sh scripts, including their command-line usage, environment variable support, and underlying pg_dump/psql commands. Document the importance of --no-owner and --no-privileges flags in backups for cross-environment compatibility. Cover the destructive nature of restore.sh and provide safety guidelines. Include procedures for scheduled backups, retention policies, and disaster recovery testing. Address common issues such as permission errors, connection failures, and schema migration conflicts.

wiki_catalogs.name: Load Testing
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive API documentation for the k6 load testing implementation in escrowgrid. Document the purpose and workflow of positions-k6.js, which simulates high-volume position creation and state transitions. Explain the script's configuration via environment variables (API_URL, API_KEY, ASSET_ID), its staged load pattern, and request/response handling. Detail how the script validates responses for both success (201) and expected policy rejections (4xx). Describe integration with CI/CD pipelines, performance metrics to monitor, and how results inform scalability improvements. Provide usage examples, troubleshooting common execution errors, and guidance for modifying the script to test other endpoints or workflows.

wiki_catalogs.name: Infrastructure Services
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the infrastructure services in escrowgrid. Describe the high-level design of components that handle external integrations, including API key storage, audit logging, health checks, metrics collection, and ledger clients. Explain the dual ledger architecture with inMemoryLedger and postgresLedger for off-chain operations and onchainLedger for Ethereum integration via Ethers.js. Document the role of ledgerClient as an abstraction layer. Illustrate how services like health.ts expose readiness and liveness probes for container orchestration. Address scalability considerations, failure modes, and monitoring approaches. Include configuration dependencies from config.ts and integration points with other layers.

wiki_catalogs.name: Audit Logging Framework
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the audit logging framework in escrowgrid. Explain how audit.ts defines audit event structures and integrates with the infrastructure layer's auditLogger implementation. Document the AuditEventInput and AuditEvent interfaces, and how they capture critical operational data including API key context, HTTP method, resource type, and action. Provide concrete examples from the codebase showing audit events triggered during institution, asset, or position modifications. Explain the relationship between domain-level audit specifications and pluggable infrastructure implementations (InMemoryAuditLogger and PostgresAuditLogger). Address common issues such as missing audit trails, schema evolution, and log retention. Include performance considerations for high-volume logging and guidance on securing audit data access.

wiki_catalogs.name: Health Checks
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed documentation for the health check system in escrowgrid. Explain the purpose and implementation of the checkReadiness function, which evaluates system readiness based on storage backend and database connectivity. Document the ReadinessStatus interface and its response structure for container orchestration systems like Kubernetes. Describe how health checks differ between in-memory and PostgreSQL backends, including connection testing and error handling. Explain integration with the Express server through the /health/readiness endpoint. Provide guidance on interpreting health check responses, troubleshooting connectivity issues, and configuring timeouts. Include best practices for monitoring, alerting, and using health probes in deployment pipelines.

wiki_catalogs.name: Positions API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the Positions API endpoints in escrowgrid. Document the POST /, GET /, GET /:id, and POST /:id/transition routes with their HTTP methods, request/response schemas, and authentication requirements. Explain the position creation process including validation of assetId, holderReference, currency, and amount, as well as policy enforcement based on institution and region. Detail the transition mechanism that applies state changes via applyTransition and records events in the ledger. Include examples of creating a position and transitioning it through lifecycle states. Describe error handling for invalid amounts, policy violations, and unauthorized transitions. Highlight integration with policyStore, ledgerClient, and auditLogger. Explain how position events are stored and how the state machine enforces valid transitions.

wiki_catalogs.name: Request Logging Middleware
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the request logging middleware in escrowgrid. Explain how requestLogger captures key metadata including HTTP method, path, status code, duration, API key ID, and institution ID for audit and debugging purposes. Detail the use of process.hrtime.bigint() for high-resolution timing and the res.on('finish') event to log after response completion. Describe the structured JSON logging format and integration with external systems via console output. Explain the dual purpose of logging and performance monitoring through recordRequestMetric calls. Provide code examples showing middleware chaining in server.ts and interaction with auth.ts to access authentication context. Address common issues such as log volume management, PII leakage risks, and performance overhead of synchronous console logging. Include best practices for log aggregation, retention, and integration with observability platforms.

wiki_catalogs.name: PostgreSQL Storage Implementation
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed documentation for the PostgreSQL storage implementation (postgresStore.ts). Explain how PostgresStore uses the pg Pool to manage database connections and execute parameterized queries against the defined schema. Document the mapping between domain entities and database tables (institutions, asset_templates, assets, positions, position_events), including field transformations and type casting. Detail the implementation of ACID-compliant transactions, particularly in updatePosition where position updates and lifecycle events are committed atomically. Explain query construction, indexing strategies, and connection pooling configuration. Address error handling for database connectivity issues, constraint violations, and serialization failures. Provide performance optimization tips including index usage, query planning, and connection pool sizing. Include setup instructions for database initialization using schema.sql and environment configuration via requirePostgresUrl.

wiki_catalogs.name: Ledger Abstraction Layer
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the ledger abstraction layer in escrowgrid, centered on the LedgerClient interface and CompositeLedger implementation. Explain how this abstraction decouples business logic from specific ledger backends, enabling pluggable storage and on-chain integration. Detail the methods defined in the LedgerClient interfacerecordPositionCreated, recordPositionStateChangedand their unified signatures across implementations. Describe the CompositeLedger pattern that allows atomic dual writes to both base (off-chain) and on-chain ledgers when enabled. Illustrate the runtime composition in ledgerClient.ts where configuration determines active components. Provide code examples showing how domain logic interacts with the ledger client without awareness of underlying implementations. Discuss benefits for testability, extensibility, and operational flexibility. Address edge cases such as partial failures in composite writes and how they are logged and handled. Include guidance for extending the abstraction with new ledger types.

wiki_catalogs.name: API Reference
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for all public RESTful endpoints in the escrowgrid platform. Document HTTP methods, URL patterns, request/response schemas (using OpenAPI/Swagger standards), authentication requirements (API keys, JWT), and error handling. Cover all API groups: institutions, assets, positions, ledger, policies, and metrics. For each endpoint, specify parameters, return values, status codes, and usage examples. Include security considerations, rate limiting behavior, and versioning strategy. Reference openapi.ts for schema generation details. Provide client implementation guidelines and demonstrate real-world usage scenarios from the codebase.

wiki_catalogs.name: Position Model
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the Position entity in the escrowgrid platform. Detail all fields: id, institutionId, assetId, holderReference, currency, amount, state, externalReference, createdAt, updatedAt, and the embedded events array. Explain that positions represent financial escrow accounts or holdings tied to specific assets and holders, forming the core of the TaaS platform. Document the primary key on id, foreign keys to institutions(id) and assets(id) with cascade delete, and indexes on institution_id, asset_id, and holder_reference for query optimization. Describe the state field using the PositionState enum (CREATED, FUNDED, RELEASED, etc.) to track lifecycle progression. Reference schema.sql for database structure and types.ts for the TypeScript interface. Include sample data showing a funded position in USD. Explain the one-to-many relationship with position_events for auditability and discuss validation rules around amount precision (NUMERIC(32,8)) and state transitions.

wiki_catalogs.name: Ledger API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed API documentation for the Ledger API in escrowgrid, which provides visibility into financial transactions and events. Document the GET /ledger endpoint with support for filtering by institutionId, assetId, positionId, and date ranges. Specify query parameters, pagination controls, and response structure including event type, timestamp, and payload. Explain the dual ledger design: off-chain (PostgreSQL or in-memory) and on-chain (Ethereum via onchainLedger), and how events are recorded across both systems. Highlight the read-only nature of the API and its use for reconciliation and auditing. Reference integration with auditLogger and policyStore for compliance tracking. Include authentication requirements using institution-scoped API keys and root access. Provide usage examples for retrieving position lifecycle events and monitoring settlement activities. Address performance implications of large ledger queries and recommend indexing strategies based on db/schema.sql.

wiki_catalogs.name: Middleware
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the middleware components in escrowgrid. Explain the purpose and execution order of authentication, rate limiting, and request logging middleware. Detail how auth.ts validates API keys and enforces role-based access control (root vs institution-level keys). Describe the rate limiting strategy using in-memory counters and its configuration. Explain how requestLogger captures metadata for debugging and auditing. Provide code examples showing middleware registration in server.ts and interaction with Express request lifecycle. Address common issues like unauthorized access attempts or log overload, and performance implications of synchronous logging.

wiki_catalogs.name: Domain Data Modeling
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for escrowgrid's core domain entities. Detail the TypeScript interfaces defined in types.ts including Institution, AssetTemplate, Asset, Position, and their relationships. Explain how verticals.ts defines and manages vertical-specific constraints and configurations. Document field definitions, data types, primary identifiers, and business invariants enforced at the domain level. Include examples of how these models are used in API requests, database persistence, and policy evaluation. Explain the role of enums like PositionState and AssetVertical in maintaining data integrity. Address common modeling issues such as optional vs required fields, versioning of data structures, and backward compatibility. Provide guidance on extending models for new verticals or regulatory requirements.

wiki_catalogs.name: Metrics Collection
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create operational documentation for the metrics collection system in escrowgrid. Detail the RequestMetricsSnapshot interface and internal counters for tracking total requests, errors, status codes, HTTP methods, and latency. Explain how recordRequestMetric captures timing and outcome data during request processing, and how getRequestMetricsSnapshot exposes aggregated metrics for monitoring. Document integration with request logging middleware and exposure via the /metrics endpoint. Describe use cases for performance analysis, anomaly detection, and capacity planning. Include examples of metric interpretation, common performance bottlenecks, and recommendations for setting up external monitoring and alerting. Address memory usage considerations for long-running processes.

wiki_catalogs.name: Policies API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the Policies API endpoints in escrowgrid. Document the GET /institutions/:id/policies, GET /institutions/:id/policies/:region, and PUT /institutions/:id/policies/:region routes with their HTTP methods, request/response schemas, and authentication requirements. Explain how policies are scoped to institutions and regions (US, EU_UK, SG, UAE) and used to enforce constraints on position creation such as min/max amounts and allowed currencies. Describe access control rules that restrict policy management to root users or institution admins. Include examples of retrieving and updating policy configurations. Detail validation rules for policy parameters and error conditions like invalid regions or malformed request bodies. Explain the relationship between policies and position creation in the positions API and how policyStore manages persistence.

wiki_catalogs.name: Storage Initialization and Configuration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create documentation for storage initialization and configuration mechanisms. Explain how index.ts determines and instantiates the appropriate storage backend based on configuration settings in config.ts. Document the configuration-driven selection logic between memoryStore and PostgresStore implementations. Detail environment variables that control storage behavior, including POSTGRES_URL for database connectivity. Describe the factory pattern used in createPostgresStore and conditional export logic in index.ts. Provide examples of configuration scenarios for development (in-memory) versus production (PostgreSQL) environments. Include troubleshooting guidance for common initialization failures such as missing database connections or invalid configuration values. Address extension points for adding new storage backends and registering them in the initialization logic.

wiki_catalogs.name: Data Models & Database Schema
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the escrowgrid platform. Detail all core entities: Institution, AssetTemplate, Asset, Position, and LedgerEvent. Document field definitions, data types, primary/foreign keys, indexes, and constraints. Explain entity relationships using an ER diagram. Describe business rules and validation logic tied to each model. Include sample data records and explain data access patterns. Reference schema.sql for DDL statements and types.ts for TypeScript interfaces. Discuss data lifecycle, retention policies, and migration strategies. Address data security and access control implications.

wiki_catalogs.name: Position Events Model
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the PositionEvents (position_events table) entity in the escrowgrid platform. Detail all fields: id, positionId, fromState, toState, reason, at, metadata, and createdAt. Explain that position events implement event sourcing for position lifecycle tracking, providing an immutable audit trail of state transitions. Document the primary key on id, foreign key to positions(id) with cascade delete, and the idx_position_events_position index for efficient event retrieval. Describe how fromState can be null (for initial creation) and toState is required, enabling reconstruction of position state at any point in time. Reference schema.sql for DDL and types.ts for the PositionLifecycleEvent interface. Include sample data showing a transition from CREATED to FUNDED. Discuss the role of events in compliance, debugging, and policy enforcement, and explain how metadata supports extensible context recording.

wiki_catalogs.name: Policies API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop comprehensive API documentation for the Policies API, which enables dynamic rule configuration for financial operations in escrowgrid. Document endpoints for creating, listing, and deleting policies scoped to institutions and verticals. Specify the policy configuration schema including conditions, constraints, and actions that govern asset and position behaviors. Detail how policies are evaluated during critical operations like position creation or state transitions via the domain/policy.ts module. Explain the relationship between policy rules and API key roles (e.g., admin override capabilities). Include examples of common policy types such as transaction limits, geographic restrictions, or approval workflows. Describe error responses when policy checks fail and how they integrate with audit logging. Cover authentication using root or institution admin API keys. Provide guidance on testing policy logic using the existing Vitest setup and demonstrate usage patterns from integration tests.

wiki_catalogs.name: Storage Layer
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model and persistence documentation for the storage layer of escrowgrid. Detail the pluggable architecture that supports both in-memory and PostgreSQL-backed storage through a common interface defined in store.ts. Explain how configuration in config.ts determines the active store and how index.ts initializes the appropriate implementation. Document the data access patterns, transaction handling, and query methods used by higher layers. Include performance considerations for each backend, such as memory pressure in memoryStore or connection pooling in postgresStore. Address data consistency, initialization procedures, and extension points for adding new storage backends.

wiki_catalogs.name: External Stores
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop architectural documentation for the external store services in escrowgrid, focusing on apiKeyStore and policyStore implementations. Explain how these stores provide pluggable persistence for API keys and institutional policies using the same pattern as the main storage layer. Detail the interfaces (ApiKeyStore, PolicyStore) and their in-memory vs PostgreSQL implementations, including CRUD operations and query methods. Describe configuration-driven instantiation based on storeBackend setting. Document data access patterns, error handling, and transactional behavior. Explain integration points with authentication middleware and policy enforcement engine. Provide examples of key management workflows and policy retrieval for compliance checks. Address consistency requirements and performance characteristics of each backend.

wiki_catalogs.name: Ledger API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the Ledger API endpoint in escrowgrid. Document the GET / route with its query parameter (positionId), response schema, and authentication requirements. Explain how the ledger API provides an audit trail of position lifecycle events and integrates with the ledgerClient to retrieve events from potentially multiple backends (in-memory, PostgreSQL, on-chain). Describe access control rules that restrict ledger access to root users or institution members with appropriate permissions. Include examples of querying all ledger events (root only) and filtering by positionId. Detail error handling for non-existent positions and unauthorized access. Explain the relationship between ledger events and position state transitions recorded by the positions API.

wiki_catalogs.name: Storage & Persistence
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the storage and persistence layer in escrowgrid. Describe the pluggable storage architecture supporting in-memory and PostgreSQL backends. Explain the Store interface and its implementations (memoryStore, postgresStore). Document configuration options via config.ts and environment variables. Detail data consistency, transaction handling, and performance characteristics of each backend. Discuss use cases for each storage type (development vs production). Include integration with the ledger system and implications on durability and scalability.

wiki_catalogs.name: Ledger Events Model
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the LedgerEvents (ledger_events table) entity in the escrowgrid platform. Detail all fields: id, kind, positionId, at, previousState, newState, payload, and createdAt. Explain that ledger events record all significant financial and operational changes to positions, serving as the system of record for on- and off-chain reconciliation. Document the primary key on id, foreign key to positions(id) with cascade delete, and the idx_ledger_events_position index for fast lookups. Describe the kind field as a discriminator for event types (e.g., 'DEPOSIT', 'RELEASE'), and payload as JSONB for flexible data inclusion. Reference schema.sql for DDL and note the absence of a direct TypeScript interface (implying runtime construction). Include sample data for a release event. Discuss dual ledger design implications, integration with onchainLedger.ts, and how these events support auditability and regulatory compliance.

wiki_catalogs.name: Metrics API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the Metrics API endpoint in escrowgrid, which exposes system telemetry for monitoring and observability. Document the GET /metrics endpoint that returns Prometheus-formatted time-series data. List all available metrics including HTTP request counts, latency histograms, active connections, ledger operation durations, and policy evaluation rates. Specify the text/plain content type and scraping interval recommendations. Explain how metrics are collected via the infra/metrics.ts module and updated across key operations like authentication, position transitions, and database interactions. Reference integration with external monitoring systems like Grafana or Prometheus. Include security considerations: access control via API key (recommended read_only) and network exposure recommendations. Provide example queries for alerting on error rates or performance degradation. Address high-cardinality risks and suggest labeling strategies based on institutionId and endpoint.

wiki_catalogs.name: Metrics API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the Metrics API endpoint in escrowgrid. Document the GET / route with its response schema and strict authentication requirements (root-only access). Explain how this endpoint provides a snapshot of request metrics through getRequestMetricsSnapshot from the infrastructure layer. Describe the use case for system monitoring and operational visibility. Include an example of the metrics response structure. Detail the security rationale for restricting access to root users only. Explain how metrics are collected and aggregated within the application and how this endpoint supports operational monitoring and performance analysis.

wiki_catalogs.name: Security & Authentication
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the security and authentication mechanisms in escrowgrid. Detail the API key-based authentication system with root and institutional keys. Explain role-based access control (admin, read_only) and JWT/Bearer token support. Document the authentication middleware flow, key validation, and session management. Describe API key lifecycle management (creation, revocation, rotation). Include security best practices, threat models, and protection against common vulnerabilities. Reference auth.ts for implementation details and integration with API routes.

wiki_catalogs.name: API Keys API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed API documentation for the API Keys management endpoints in escrowgrid, which enable secure access control for institutions and root users. Document the POST /api-keys endpoint for creating new keys with role assignment (admin, read_only), and the DELETE /api-keys/:id endpoint for revocation. Specify request parameters including institutionId (for non-root users), role, and optional metadata. Detail the response format containing the generated token (server-only) and key metadata (id, role, createdAt). Emphasize that tokens are not stored in plaintext and cannot be retrieved after creation. Explain the authentication flow using Bearer tokens validated by authMiddleware, including rootApiKey bypass logic. Reference integration with apiKeyStore and auditLogger for tracking key usage and creation. Include security best practices: token storage, rotation policies, and least-privilege role assignment. Provide usage examples for bootstrapping institutional access and securing automated clients.

wiki_catalogs.name: API Keys API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the API Keys API endpoints in escrowgrid. Document the POST /institutions/:id/api-keys and GET /institutions/:id/api-keys routes with their HTTP methods, request/response schemas, and authentication requirements. Explain how API keys are created with labels and roles (admin, read_only) and how the apiKeyStore manages their lifecycle. Describe access control rules that restrict API key management to root users or institution admins. Include examples of creating a new API key and listing existing keys for an institution. Detail the security-sensitive response that includes the actual API key token only on creation. Explain integration with audit logging (API_KEY_CREATED) and the relationship between API keys and institutional access control in the authentication middleware.

wiki_catalogs.name: On-chain Integration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the on-chain ledger integration in escrowgrid. Explain how the platform connects to Ethereum via Ethers.js, records ledger events on-chain, and manages transaction lifecycle. Detail configuration options for network selection, gas handling, and contract interaction. Describe the dual ledger design (off-chain and on-chain) and synchronization mechanisms. Document event recording patterns, confirmation handling, and failure recovery. Address security considerations for private key management and transaction signing.

wiki_catalogs.name: Monitoring & Operations
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the monitoring and operations capabilities of escrowgrid. Document health checks and readiness probes for Kubernetes environments. Explain metrics collection (Prometheus format), logging infrastructure, and request tracing. Describe the implementation of health.ts and metrics.ts, including exposed endpoints and data formats. Cover log aggregation, monitoring dashboards, and alerting strategies. Include operational best practices for production deployment and incident response.

wiki_catalogs.name: Deployment & Configuration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for deploying and configuring the escrowgrid platform. Detail Docker and docker-compose deployment workflows, including container networking and volume management. Explain environment variable configuration via config.ts and .env files. Document database setup, backup and restore procedures using provided scripts. Cover production deployment best practices, scaling considerations, and environment-specific configurations. Include step-by-step deployment guides for different environments (development, staging, production).

wiki_catalogs.name: Testing Strategy
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content detailing the testing strategy for escrowgrid. Cover unit testing with Vitest, including setup in vitest.config.ts and test organization. Explain integration testing patterns for API endpoints and database interactions. Document load testing using k6 scripts in the load/ directory, focusing on positions performance. Describe test coverage goals, mocking strategies, and CI/CD integration. Include guidance for writing new tests and debugging test failures. Reference actual test files for concrete examples.

wiki_catalogs.name: Developer Guide
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create a practical developer guide for contributing to the escrowgrid codebase. Provide step-by-step setup instructions for local development, including dependency installation, database configuration, and service startup. Document coding standards, linting rules (eslint.config.js), and TypeScript configuration. Explain the contribution workflow, branch management, and pull request process. Include debugging tips, development server commands, and IDE setup recommendations. Reference package.json scripts and configuration files for tooling details.

wiki_overview.content:
<blog>
# Comprehensive Project Analysis of EscrowGrid

## 1. Project Introduction

### Purpose Statement
EscrowGrid is a Trust-as-a-Service (TaaS) platform designed to manage financial positions, assets, and institutional relationships with robust audit logging, policy enforcement, and multi-backend storage support. The system enables secure creation, tracking, and lifecycle management of financial positions with optional on-chain ledger integration for enhanced transparency.

### Core Goals and Objectives
- Provide a secure API for managing financial positions and assets
- Support both in-memory and PostgreSQL persistence with seamless switching
- Enable policy-driven constraints on financial operations
- Offer audit trails and API key management for compliance
- Facilitate on-chain ledger integration for selected asset types
- Deliver comprehensive API documentation and monitoring capabilities

### Target Audience
- Financial institutions requiring escrow services
- Platform administrators managing multiple institutions
- Developers integrating with the TaaS API
- Compliance officers needing audit trails and policy enforcement
- System operators requiring monitoring and health checks

## 2. Technical Architecture

### Component Breakdown
The project follows a layered architecture with clear separation of concerns:

- **API Layer**: Express.js routers handling HTTP requests
- **Business Logic**: Domain models and lifecycle management
- **Infrastructure**: Data access, ledger clients, and external integrations
- **Storage**: Pluggable store implementations (memory/postgres)
- **Security**: Authentication, authorization, and rate limiting middleware

### Design Patterns
- **Router Pattern**: Modular Express routers for different resource types
- **Dependency Injection**: Configuration and infrastructure services injected into components
- **Policy Pattern**: Externalized rules for position creation and transitions
- **Event Sourcing**: Ledger events recorded for all position changes
- **Multi-tenancy**: Institution-based access control and data isolation

### System Relationships and Data Flow

```mermaid
flowchart TD
    A[Client] --> B[API Layer]
    B --> C[Authentication]
    C --> D[Business Logic]
    D --> E[Policy Enforcement]
    E --> F[Data Access]
    F --> G[(Database)]
    D --> H[Ledger Client]
    H --> I[PostgreSQL Ledger]
    H --> J[On-chain Ledger]
    D --> K[Audit Logger]
    K --> L[Logging System]
```

### Project Structure Overview

```mermaid
graph TD
    Root[Project Root] --> Admin[admin-console]
    Root --> DB[db]
    Root --> Load[load]
    Root --> Src[src]
    Root --> Website[website]
    
    Src --> API[api/]
    Src --> Domain[domain/]
    Src --> Infra[infra/]
    Src --> Middleware[middleware/]
    Src --> Store[store/]
    Src --> Config[config.ts]
    Src --> Server[server.ts]
```

## 3. Key Implementation

### Main Entry Points
- **Backend Server**: `src/server.ts` - Main application entry point that initializes Express app and mounts all routers
- **Frontend Admin Console**: `admin-console/src/main.tsx` - Entry point for the React-based administration interface
- **Docker Deployment**: `Dockerfile` and `docker-compose.yml` - Containerization and orchestration configuration

### Core Modules
- **API Routers**: `src/api/*.ts` - REST API endpoints for institutions, assets, positions, and ledger events
- **Domain Logic**: `src/domain/` - Business rules, lifecycle management, and type definitions
- **Infrastructure Services**: `src/infra/` - Ledger clients, audit logging, and health checks
- **Storage Layer**: `src/store/` - Pluggable data persistence with memory and PostgreSQL implementations

### Configuration Approach
The configuration system uses environment variables with sensible defaults and type safety:

```typescript
export interface AppConfig {
  port: number;
  storeBackend: 'memory' | 'postgres';
  postgresUrl?: string;
  rootApiKey?: string;
  onchainLedgerEnabled: boolean;
  rateLimitEnabled: boolean;
  rateLimitWindowMs: number;
  rateLimitMaxRequests: number;
}
```

Sources:
- [config.ts](src/config.ts#L1-L47)

### External Dependencies
Key dependencies from `package.json`:

- **Express**: Web framework for API endpoints
- **PostgreSQL**: Database driver for persistent storage
- **Ethers**: Ethereum integration for on-chain ledger
- **Swagger UI**: Interactive API documentation
- **CORS**: Cross-origin resource sharing middleware
- **Vitest**: Testing framework

Sources:
- [package.json](package.json#L1-L37)

### Integration Points
- **PostgreSQL Database**: Persistent storage with schema in `db/schema.sql`
- **On-chain Ledger**: Ethereum blockchain integration via Ethers.js
- **API Documentation**: OpenAPI/Swagger integration with interactive docs
- **Health Checks**: Kubernetes-style readiness and liveness probes
- **Rate Limiting**: Configurable request throttling based on IP

### Component Relationships

```mermaid
graph LR
    Server[src/server.ts] --> Routers[API Routers]
    Routers --> Business[Domain Logic]
    Business --> Policy[policyStore]
    Business --> Ledger[ledgerClient]
    Business --> Audit[auditLogger]
    Business --> Store[store]
    Store --> MemoryStore[Memory Store]
    Store --> PostgresStore[PostgreSQL Store]
    Ledger --> PostgresLedger[PostgreSQL Ledger]
    Ledger --> OnchainLedger[On-chain Ledger]
    Server --> Middleware[auth, rateLimit, requestLogger]
```

## 4. Key Features

### Functionality Overview
- **Institution Management**: CRUD operations for financial institutions
- **Asset Templates**: Reusable templates for asset creation with region-specific policies
- **Position Lifecycle**: State machine for position transitions with audit trails
- **API Key Management**: Role-based access control with root, admin, and user roles
- **Multi-backend Storage**: Support for in-memory and PostgreSQL storage
- **On-chain Integration**: Optional blockchain recording of position events
- **Policy Enforcement**: Configurable rules for minimum/maximum amounts and currencies
- **Comprehensive Monitoring**: Health checks, metrics, and interactive API documentation

### Implementation Highlights

#### Position Creation with Policy Enforcement
When creating a position, the system enforces institution- and region-specific policies:

```mermaid
sequenceDiagram
    Client->>+API: POST /positions
    API->>+Policy Store: Get policy(institution, region)
    Policy Store-->>-API: Return policy rules
    API->>+Validation: Check amount, currency against policy
    Validation-->>-API: Validation result
    API->>+Store: Create position
    Store-->>-API: Position created
    API->>+Ledger: Record creation event
    Ledger-->>-API: Event recorded
    API->>+Audit: Log creation
    Audit-->>-Client: Position created
```

Sources:
- [positions.ts](src/api/positions.ts#L1-L298)

#### Multi-Ledger Architecture
The system supports multiple ledger backends simultaneously:

```mermaid
classDiagram
    class LedgerClient {
        <<interface>>
        +recordPositionCreated(Position)
        +recordPositionStateChanged(Position, Event)
        +listEvents(params)
    }
    
    class PostgresLedger {
        +recordPositionCreated()
        +recordPositionStateChanged()
        +listEvents()
    }
    
    class OnchainLedger {
        +recordPositionCreated()
        +recordPositionStateChanged()
    }
    
    class LedgerClientImpl {
        +postgresLedger: PostgresLedger
        +onchainLedger: OnchainLedger
        +recordPositionCreated()
        +recordPositionStateChanged()
    }
    
    LedgerClient <|.. PostgresLedger
    LedgerClient <|.. OnchainLedger
    LedgerClientImpl ..|> LedgerClient
```

Sources:
- [postgresLedger.ts](src/infra/postgresLedger.ts#L1-L108)
- [onchainLedger.ts](src/infra/onchainLedger.ts#L1-L221)
- [ledgerClient.ts](src/infra/ledgerClient.ts)

#### Authentication and Authorization Flow
The system implements role-based access control with three tiers:

```mermaid
stateDiagram-v2
    [*] --> Unauthenticated
    Unauthenticated --> Authenticated: Valid API Key
    Authenticated --> RootAccess: role=root
    Authenticated --> AdminAccess: role=admin && institution match
    Authenticated --> Forbidden: Insufficient privileges
    RootAccess --> PositionOperations: Full access
    AdminAccess --> PositionOperations: Institution-limited access
    PositionOperations --> AuditLog: Record action
    AuditLog --> Response: Return result
```

Sources:
- [auth.ts](src/middleware/auth.ts)
- [apiKeys.ts](src/api/apiKeys.ts#L1-L110)

#### Data Model Relationships
The core entities and their relationships:

```mermaid
erDiagram
    INSTITUTION ||--o{ ASSET_TEMPLATE : "has"
    INSTITUTION ||--o{ ASSET : "manages"
    INSTITUTION ||--o{ POSITION : "holds"
    ASSET_TEMPLATE ||--o{ ASSET : "instantiates"
    ASSET ||--o{ POSITION : "backed by"
    POSITION ||--o{ LEDGER_EVENT : "generates"
    INSTITUTION ||--o{ API_KEY : "has"
    POLICY ||--|{ ASSET_TEMPLATE : "applies to"
```

Sources:
- [types.ts](src/domain/types.ts)
- [schema.sql](db/schema.sql)
</blog>
